column1: Hemoglobin is a protein in red cells that carries oxygen.

A higher than normal reticulocytes count may indicate: - Anemia due to red blood cells being destroyed earlier than normal (hemolytic anemia) - Bleeding - Blood disorder in a fetus or newborn known as erythroblastosis fetalis - Kidney disease, with increased production of a hormone called erythropoietin A lower than normal reticulocyte count may indicate: - Bone marrow failure (for example, from drug toxicity, tumor, radiation therapy, or infection) - Cirrhosis of the liver - Anemia caused by low iron levels - Chronic kidney disease - Anemia caused by low levels of Vitamin B12 or folate Reticulocyte count may be increased during pregnancy.
